items.compliance_question: What is the compliance state for Password Management?
relevant_quotes: ID Requirement Minimum Standard Evidence/Deliverable Frequency PASS- 01 Password length/strength standard admin 14+ chars; (PAGE 15)

hers 12+ password standard excerpt annual review PASS- 02 Break-glass credential controls vault + rotation every 90 days vault logs + rotation record quarterly verification PASS- 03 Brute force protections lockout/rate limiting configuratio (PAGE 15)
lockout/rate limiting configuration evidence continuous PASS- 04 Prohibit known-compromised passwords screening/controls policy + tool output summary continuous (PAGE 15)
items.rationale: The contract requires a minimum password length of 14 characters for administrative accounts and 12 characters for others, as well as annual reviews. It also mandates the use of a vault for storing privileged credentials and their rotation every 90 days, along with continuous lockout/rate limiting and prohibition of known-compromised passwords through screening controls.

items.compliance_question: What is the compliance state for IT Asset Management?
relevant_quotes: Vendor will maintain an inventory of in-scope assets, including cloud accounts/subscriptions, production workloads, databases, and security tooling. (PAGE 7)
Vendor will review and reconcile the in-scope asset inventory at least quarterly and upon material changes. (PAGE 7)
Vendor will maintain secure configuration baselines (e.g., CIS benchmarks or equivalent) for in-scope systems and will remediate material drift in a timely manner. (PAGE 7)
The inventory will identify environment (prod/non-prod), owner, and criticality. (PAGE 7)
items.rationale: The contract requires an in-scope asset inventory with minimum fields, defines the frequency of reconciliation, and mandates secure configuration baselines with drift remediation and prohibition of insecure defaults. The evidence provided indicates that the vendor is maintaining an asset inventory, reviewing it quarterly, and implementing secure configuration baselines.

items.compliance_question: Compliance requirement: 3 Security Training & Background Checks. The contract must require security awareness training on hire and at least annually, and background screening for personnel with access to Company Data to the extent permitted by law, including maintaining a screening policy and attestation/evidence.
relevant_quotes: + annual refresh training completion report annual GOV- 05 Personnel screening for Vendor Personnel with access background checks to the extent permitted by law screening policy + attestation on hire; periodic where lawful (PAGE 14)
items.rationale: The contract explicitly states that background checks are required for personnel with access to Company Data, and that these checks must be performed on hire and periodically where lawful.

items.compliance_question: What is the compliance state for Data in Transit Encryption?
relevant_quotes: encrypt Company Data in transit and at rest. 7.2 Data in Transit Requirements (TLS). Vendor will enforce encryption in transit for all external and internal transmissions of Company Data over untrusted networks, including: (a) Company-to-Service connections (w (PAGE 5)

extent they carry Company Data; and (c) administrative connections to production systems. Vendor will use TLS 1.2 or higher (TLS 1.3 where feasible), will not knowingly enable insecure cipher suites, and will manage certificates using documented procedures. (PAGE 5)
items.rationale: The contract requires encryption of Company Data in transit using TLS 1.2 or higher (preferably TLS 1.3), with certificate management and avoidance of insecure cipher suites for Company-to-Service connections, Service-to-Subprocessor transfers, and administrative access pathways.

items.compliance_question: What is the compliance state for Network Authentication and Authorization Protocols?
relevant_quotes: uthentication and authorization for the Services as follows: (a) End-user authentication. SAML 2.0 SSO is supported and is the default for Company; local user accounts (if enabled) must enforce MFA and password controls consistent with Section 6.6. (b) API aut (PAGE 5)

d tokens, with scoped permissions and configurable expiration. (c) Administrative access. Administrative access to production will occur only via the approved bastion/secure gateway with MFA and session logging. (d) Authorization. Vendor will enforce RBAC with (PAGE 5)

via the approved bastion/secure gateway with MFA and session logging. (d) Authorization. Vendor will enforce RBAC within the application and administrative tooling and will document the role model for Company upon request. Authentication/Authorization Summary  (PAGE 5)
items.rationale: The contract specifies the use of SAML SSO for end-users, MFA for local user accounts, OAuth 2.0 tokens for API access, and RBAC for administrative access to production. These requirements meet the compliance requirement for Network Authentication and Authorization Protocols.
